After three years of writing Compose code, I still find myself frequently Googling ‚Äúhow to center items in Row/Column/Box‚Äù because I haven‚Äôt memorized all the permutations of arrangement and alignment parameters. I finally made a visual cheat sheet for this. Hope it‚Äôs helpful for anyone else who spends too much time Googling or asking AI how to center things!

These tables are also available in my android-cheatsheet repo, where I collect visual guides for Android development.

A rule of thumb is that Arrangement parameters specify the placement of children in the main axis direction (eg. horizontalArrangement for Row and verticalArrangement for Column), whereas the Alignment parameters specify their placement in the cross axis direction (eg. verticalAlignment for Row and horizontalAlignment for Column)

This post isn‚Äôt intended to go into technical details, so here are some articles that do:
